events.message: The insured reported a vehicle accident involving a collision with another car at an intersection, resulting in visible damage to the front bumper and headlights.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under the Auto Accident cluster due to keywords related to a car collision and vehicle damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claimantâ€™s case to guide through the process and provide timely updates on progress.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that the incident details were recorded accurately.
The claimant was asked to provide photographs of the damaged vehicle, a police report, and a copy of the driver's license for claim verification.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including damage photos, police report, and identification, facilitating further claim processing.
The investigation team began examining the accident circumstances to determine liability and assess the extent of vehicle damage.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the claimant was not at fault; damage estimates were evaluated and vehicle repair costs calculated.
A settlement amount was proposed to the claimant covering repair costs and rental car expenses during the repair period.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the communication throughout the claim process.
The claim approval was finalized based on the investigation outcomes and customer agreement on the proposed settlement amount.
The payment covering vehicle repairs and associated costs was issued to the claimant promptly following claim approval.
The insurance claim case was closed after successful payment and confirmation from the claimant that vehicle repairs were completed.
All claim files and related documents were archived in the system for future reference and audit compliance purposes.
